TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {71985=This is not a very expensive college, and provides many opportunities for scholarships. You will get the same learning experiences here as you will at any other college. Typically, you're looking at about a 30:1 student/teacher ratio, which is good - You're in a good classroom setting., 80891=The average cost for an ASU full-time (12 hrs) undergraduate is $2800/semester. For the courses/services offered towards the available degrees, the cost of attendance for ASU students is favorable among most., 306392=There is an arch that once marked the entrance to the college and is now the oldest structure on campus. It was donated by the Training School Class of 1927. It is said that if you walk under the Arch, you will never graduate!, 327681=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: The tuition is really cheap here at ASU compared to the two other major colleges in Arkansas (University of Arkansas and University of Central Arkansas), and the 'bang' you get for your buck greatly exceeds your buck! What you pay is small compared to what you get out of it. Am enjoying being here College life is great here. Fraternities/Sororities, Student clubs and groups, great athletic opprotunities, there really is something for everyone! Am learning a lot I am a Music Education Major at ASU-Jonesboro. I've been studying music for years, being in band in High School and Jr. High, as well as playing various instruments since elementary, but I am amazed by how much I learn every day from my music classes. Top notch teachers at ASU Login to rate or flag the reviews Brooke from Cave City, AR 12/02/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 10 out of 10 people found this review useful. 4 of 82
